unit_learning_outcomes.description: Analyse and draw conclusions about the mechanisms of bilingualism and related studies.
Critically evaluate bilingual education models adopted in different countries.
Contextualise the important roles of family, school, society and culture in bilingual education.
Develop and apply understandings of the theoretical foundations of bilingual education.
Appraise curriculum design theories in strategic planning, implementation and evaluation related to bilingual education.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to prepare for their lecture/tutorials via reading and/or online participation.
Students are expected to read the prescribed and recommended texts after each lecture/tutorial.

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to MEd or MEdLead or MEChild or MTeach(Sec) or GradCertEdStud

assessments.description: Students are required to present and participate their reading and analysis either in workshop or via an online discussion forum.
Students are required to submit a critical review (~2500 words) of bilingual education in a chosen region/country.

data.subject_search_title: EDST8312 - Bilingual Education: Theory and Practice
data.description: This unit examines the psychological, pedagogical, practical, and policy foundations of bilingual education in an increasingly globalised world. It presents an overview of the types of bilingual programs and the principles of effective bilingual education including theory, research, and effective strategies. This unit offers the opportunity to participate in an international/local trip and field experience in bilingual schools. Students participating in this field experience are expected to conduct additional research on a selected topic on bilingual education and write a research paper of their findings.
